column1: My family spent the morning at @SVdP packaging food boxes for distribution. Thanks to their generous staff and volunteers for helping our community get through these difficult times.   For those in a position to help this Thanksgiving you can donate here: https://t.co/v1rxOqWA2J https://t.co/C8b1zRkSBi

I’m proud to support @RaquelTeran for AZ Democratic State Party Chair. We have worked together for many years to move our state forward. No one will work harder smarter or more strategically to advance our shared values. Let’s go!!! https://t.co/4eMhbWag2i

This morning I recognized a great Phoenician Reverend Patrick Stout for 50 years of service to Community Church of Hope and our community. The Church has always welcomed me when I visit and has a beautiful theme of loving everyone. https://t.co/VaHEZbviXF

Very happy for State Senator-elect @ChristinePMarsh. I’ve worked closely with her for 4 years through 2 elections. Strength resilience commitment focus ethical...these words best describe this amazing leader. Her passion to serve others will now be seen by all of AZ. https://t.co/RXwEwJSbDt

I’m a proud American tonight as @kamalaharris takes the stage as our nation’s first female Vice President-elect—and a grateful dad as she breaks a hard glass ceiling and inspires girls across the country including my daughter Violet.

.@JoeBiden knows that a creating a more perfect union calls on all of us to work together to build a nation with real opportunity and justice for everyone. I look forward to working with him on our shared mission: Improving lives of Arizonans and all Americans.

I just spoke with Scottsdale Mayor-elect David Ortega. He and I have worked together for 20 years- starting when we served as council members for Phoenix and Scottsdale respectively. I’m looking forward to working closely with him to advance Scottsdale and our region.

I’m so proud of our elections officials. They’re doing a great job. And while it may take a little longer to count every vote we’re used to that in Arizona. But here we count every vote—safely and securely—and we always will.

That’s what is happening right now: Ballots dropped off at polling locations are being counted just as they've done in previous elections. There has never been an issue and there isn’t an issue today. Any “controversy” is literally made up.

Here’s why the count in Arizona is taking some extra time: In our state voters can drop off their mail-in ballots at polling locations on Election Day. Elections officials verify signatures on each ballot by hand then count them. It takes time.
We’ve proven that voting by mail is safe and secure—and makes it easier for everyone to participate in our democracy.   Until President Trump started losing Arizona that has never been a question.

For many years now Arizona has been a real leader in early voting. We’ve been voting by mail since the 1990s—it was started by a Republican governor and a Republican legislature and it has earned strong bipartisan support for decades now.
There’s a lot of attention on Arizona ballot counting right now so here’s some background for those interested:

.@GeneralBrnovich using his office to advance an unfounded right-wing conspiracy to undermine the results of an election is outrageous and unacceptable. Deeply unethical behavior from a law enforcement officer. https://t.co/ShpCnikN2M

President Nez- I appreciate our close working relationship and look forward to supporting the Navajo Nation during the 117th Congress. Your strong leadership during this COVID crisis is a model for others to emulate. https://t.co/3NaRjl3crq

I am deeply honored by this win and incredibly grateful for every person who has helped along the way. I’m ready to get to work to create an Arizona that works everyone and to continue to deliver results for our state. https://t.co/opayM2sLuF
My thoughts are with @AllisterAdel her husband and two children. I join all Arizonans in expressing gratitude for the doctors who acted swiftly and praying for a swift and full recovery.
Polls are closing. If you were in line before 7:00 p.m. you are allowed to vote no matter what.  Stay in line. Your vote matters.

It’s the last day of the 2020 election. Talking with voters together with our Mayor  @KateWGallego and city council D7 candidate @yassaminansari at Burton Barr Library. Please remind everyone you know to vote by 7pm tonight! https://t.co/PdEqT0juDX
Hitting the pavement this afternoon with #ld28 State Rep. @KelliButlerAZ chasing every vote possible. No one left behind. 1 day to go. https://t.co/faR5QykTDg
Hangin’ with @RubenGallego at today’s “Low Ridin 4 Biden” Car Parade. 2 days to go. https://t.co/DA8OFui9U7
Kicking off Biden for President Latino Phonebank. 144 strong making tens of thousands of calls to voters today. No vote left behind. #2daystogo https://t.co/yb3DLymUBb
3 days left.   Canvassing in Marana AZ supporting two great candidates for state legislature—Dr. Felipe Perez and @Mendoza4AZ.  Vote and make sure everyone you know does too. https://t.co/uOPPyLNXEb

Today I welcomed our next VP @KamalaHarris to our community. @JoeBiden & Kamala are winning because they share Arizona's values: They'll defend our health care fight for comprehensive immigration reform & protect our planet.  Go vote & tell everyone you know to do the same! https://t.co/y5ZViPStdq

The stakes in this election couldn't be higher. Don’t wait—get your ballot back in right away. Tomorrow is the last recommended day to mail back your ballot.   No matter what make your plan to vote at https://t.co/gpib6gJqFc. https://t.co/gX7uy77rbV

Tragically no Governor responded to the pandemic more poorly.  He shut down the economy but failed to prepare for a safe re-opening. COVID cases and deaths surged as a result. And he still blocked local officials from taking action until public pressure forced his hand. https://t.co/jmW6fhEjkg

If this happens it would be Arizona's loss but our nation's gain. @RubenGallego and I have worked together for 15 years. He is a proactive and effective leader who makes a difference in everything he does. https://t.co/wDRuzSlScW

No place I’d rather be than in Flagstaff with 17 days to go in this election supporting Mayor Coral Evans campaign for state representative LD-6. She’s a strong leader and will represent all of Arizona well. #TeamCoral https://t.co/QIW9gsNf8k https://t.co/e8ghLkzdRk

This is the most important election of our lifetimes. This year I voted early and by mail—just like I’ve done for so many elections before. It’s easy and convenient. To make a voting plan that works for you and your family visit https://t.co/rD5fzP3KFm https://t.co/9DIRuoYmFf
My prayers are with the entire McCain family. What a remarkable life Roberta led in her 108 years. https://t.co/BuBEYkxJrJ
Early voting is now open in Arizona and I’m ready to cast my vote for @JoeBiden.   When you vote early it’s easy to make a plan that fits your schedule. Visit https://t.co/rD5fzOM9NO to learn more.

Congratulations Chevy! You have made such a positive difference in the lives of hundreds of thousands of children in Arizona including mine. Your leadership extends beyond @azsciencecenter as you have advanced science education and philanthropy in AZ. Wishing you all the best. https://t.co/b4H3sTFI94
Please do not take medical advice from this man.   COVID kills. https://t.co/0lZ8X3fppj

I’ve worked with Rep. Sierra for almost 20 years. He’s a fighter and one of the most dedicated public servants I know. Prayers up for Rhonda and Lorenzo for a full and swift recovery. https://t.co/RtXCHGUylE
Praying hard this morning for the President First Lady and every person and family impacted by this deadly virus.
@hamids @szylstra Happy Birthday. Thank you for all you do to move our community ⏩.
Anyone who refuses to condemn white supremacy is unfit for office.  https://t.co/nPvBa0TkKI

We need a leader who will put locally owned businesses and working families first—that's who @JoeBiden is.   Thanks to Sherri and Angela from @FabricTempe and Yesenia from @SalvadorenoAZ for sharing your stories with @SherrodBrown and I. https://t.co/qVsMnxBrDd

Hate cannot have a home here in Phoenix.   The Carver Museum & Cultural Center is a special place documenting African American Arizonans’ history stories and resilience. To reject the racist vandalism it suffered I encourage you to support their work: https://t.co/lVQDpU9xRN https://t.co/LhfXH4YdTO

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is one of the finest citizens and jurists in American history.   Nicole and I offer our deepest condolences to the Ginsburg family and her extended family of former clerks. https://t.co/vjcr8iMSyc
Huge playoff knockout win for our @PhoenixMercury on a last second 3 pointer by @SheyP11. It’s late here in Washington but that game was worth staying up for.

The amazing and inspirational  @Deb4CongressNM gave a powerful talk at today’s #WomenforStanton virtual event. I admire her impactful leadership as a fellow first term member of Congress. Thank you Congresswoman Haaland. https://t.co/DrkCJXYnN1

Yes this is shocking. But it is not surprising.  @realdonaldtrump will do anything to hold on to power.  Extort Ukraine. Obstruct justice. Ignore bounties on US troops. Attack peaceful protestors. Lie about a public health crisis.  There is one way to cure this disease.  Vote. https://t.co/U61GsH56Ea

I love and admire the strength of team Hodge. (@JevinforAZ @BerdettaAZ ).  Pathetic racist zoombombers didn’t put a dent into Berdetta’s party and they can’t hold back the leadership the Hodge family provides our community. https://t.co/q4JnQtgIhj

Happy Independent Bookstore Day! Today's a perfect day to treat yourself to a weekend read from your favorite local indie bookstore and reinvest your dollars here in our community.  Many like @changinghands are offering curbside pickup. Check it out: https://t.co/LV8aIZkOO1.
RIP Coach Lute. He built a powerhouse basketball program at @uarizona. I will never forget his overachieving ‘87-88 Final Four team. #respect https://t.co/rFrkDqiVHG

Still numb. Ronnie Lopez is the best of AZ. Accomplished in politics & business his greatest success was love for family loyalty to friends & standing up for his values and the ‘little guy.’ He & Angie warmly welcomed me into their familia 25 years ago. https://t.co/OQ9tV9Uera

Wishing you the best. I love Asian food and I’m grateful to you for recommending so many tasty Asian restaurants in our community.  Our local restaurants need and deserve our support. #Godspeed https://t.co/aVh1mwOFYN
Such a powerful and courageous tribute to her father tonight by Phoenix native @kdurquiza.  Turning her personal tragedy into a call to action. https://t.co/UbsFBQBvAj
@LAKISSJoe @JoeBiden @KamalaHarris Joe- I’ve had the pleasure to know her since 2006 when she was DA in San Francisco. I hope you are doing well. Phx misses you.

.@JoeBiden got it right. @KamalaHarris is everything America needs in a Vice President—a talented inclusive leader who is a proven and relentless fighter for working families.   Arizona let's roll up our sleeves and make history this November!

Two talented professionals from my team @nicolepasteur and @LarryLSandigo have joined the @JoeBiden campaign in Arizona. Their skill and work ethic will help ensure a successful 2020 campaign. They’re two of the best.

Pastor Warren H. Stewart Sr. has faithfully led @FIBC1905 for more than 40 yrs and is one of the most important civil rights leaders in Arizona history. He and his wife Karen are now among the thousands of Arizonans fighting COVID. I’m praying for their swift and full recovery.
Westy was a Hall of Fame @Suns player and coach and he’s an even better person off the court. I’m keeping him and his family in my prayers. https://t.co/kCXw8hWZki
Protecting the Grand Canyon is important to local tribes all of Arizona and our nation. @JoeBiden gets it and he’ll have Arizona’s back in the White House. https://t.co/CptNXWMEJW
Wishing the dean of our AZ congressional delegation a swift and full recovery. I’ve witnessed first hand his strong fighting spirit. https://t.co/WzJDzIQhmw
@TVets2 Of course call my office at (602) 956-2463 and leave your name email and phone number. I’ll make sure we’re in touch today. Thank you!

Every campaign I have worked for myself and others Manny has always been there. A true gentleman who fought to make life better for everyone in Arizona. He will be greatly missed. https://t.co/sZywR3HywZ
@TVets2 Can you DM your contact information? My team will get in touch with you today.

Our community lost a great champion yesterday. I was so fortunate to learn from Mike McQuaid—we worked together for nearly 20 years to end homelessness. He was so successful in business but always humble and a team player. We’ll keep doing the work Mike. Rest In Peace. https://t.co/nVjYwTW4kM
The building is also the shared headquarters of @azdemparty which sustained  significant damage as well. They will need our full support. https://t.co/Yh2vetCLJJ https://t.co/iq0SQHmFld

This fire causing major damage to the headquarters of @MaricopaDems is under investigation. Please join me in making a donation so the dedicated staff and volunteers can get up and running again ASAP.  https://t.co/jBiepJuSde https://t.co/fNAUtVsTYJ
My heart hurts over this tragic loss. My deepest sympathies go out to Julian’s family friends and the ASUYD community. https://t.co/hj7c1ANd4p

He’s one of the best people I’ve gotten to know and work with in public service. What a joy to watch him work so hard and persevere over many years and now achieve his goal. Congrats @coreywoodstempe on your swearing in today as Tempe mayor. #futureisbright https://t.co/bXqJirMJBf

One of my favorite local bookstores @ChangingHands reopens today. They're taking smart steps to keep employees and customers safe. We can all do our part too: Wear a mask sanitize hands keep 6ft. from fellow shoppers and take advantage of their curbside pickup if you need. https://t.co/knjgtwJS46

Happy Father’s Day. My Dad Fred is wonderfully consistent: he has never left my west Phoenix childhood neighborhood (Manzanita) has never lost his great sense of humor and has never stopped serving our community. https://t.co/Uh3Q0Ud6Ki
Congratulations to @thejessicamejia — an excellent choice to serve as @JoeBiden state director in Arizona.   Looking forward to working with you to put strong competent leadership in the White House!

3727 new cases in the last 48 hours in @maricopacounty. A ratio of 53 NEW cases per county contact tracer every two days. The Board of Supervisors had months to prepare and blew it. This is scandalous.   Congress provided Maricopa County $400M to battle COVID. There’s no excuse. https://t.co/6IcrFS8Psq
Very happy today for Reyna @EllePerezPerez and all Dreamers we are so fortunate to have in Arizona. https://t.co/PwwEXB4n8u
Happy Birthday to one of our greatest Arizonans @GabbyGiffords. https://t.co/HTOES3lxE0

For several days the President has chosen to ignite tensions rather than calm them; stoke fear rather than ease it. Tonight he threatened a military takeover of our cities and ordered the tear gassing of a peaceful crowd for a photo op. This is a historic failure of leadership.

We have an urgent moral imperative—as individuals communities and as a country—to do more to course correct our nation’s long history of racial violence and discrimination. Nothing can bring George Floyd back or ease the pain of his loss but his family deserves justice.

In just the past few weeks we’ve witnessed diverse but telling acts of profound racism in America. The advent of technology and a camera in everyone’s hand continue to bring to light the pain and terror Black communities have experienced for generations.

Praying hard for the two victims at Westgate and for the hundreds who just lived through the nightmare of a mass shooting. This is a terrible situation that could have been much worse—I’m grateful for the quick response from @GlendaleAZPD that undoubtedly saved lives.

Outrageous and unconscionable is right. This violence and prejudice is unacceptable and must be met with consequences. I’ll be by your side @lucymcbath to fight for #JusticeForAhmaudArbery. https://t.co/OzVmSf9nlP

Watched Ep. 6 of #TheLastDance featuring 1993 @Suns / Bulls championship finals. Our team was loaded with the most talent and depth in the NBA. Painful to watch Paxson hit that shot but at the time I was certain we would be back for more championship runs. #27yearslater...
Wishing you and your family a blessed Easter Sunday.

Join me and the Phoenix community at noon today April 7 to observe a Moment of Silence to honor fallen Phoenix Police Department Commander Greg Carnicle. We share this collective moment to honor and remember Commander Carnicle's sacrifice. #GoneButNeverForgotten https://t.co/KoYJqV09nr

This year @azgives created a Nonprofit Emergency Relief Fund to make it easy to help nonprofits losing critical funding due to coronavirus. All donations received into this fund will be distributed evenly among participating #AZGivesDay nonprofits. https://t.co/6QhLDbMD8V

Since 2013 thanks to our community's generosity @AZGives has raised $17 million for Arizona nonprofits. But this year many organizations are expecting to lose more than 25% yearly revenue due to COVID-19. These orgs provide critical services and account for 325000 AZ jobs.

Arizona’s nonprofits support our kids promote mental health address homelessness help end domestic violence provide meals to those in need and much more. We need them. If you can give this #AZGivesDay find your cause and donate at https://t.co/6QhLDbMD8V. https://t.co/quOzpkUnFc

In the 31 years since @JudeFox10 came west Phoenix has transformed into a truly world-class sports city.   Jude covered every win and heartbreaking loss along the way and he did it with humor and class. I wish him the very best in his retirement.

Every year we honor the life of Cesar Chavez an seminal labor leader and civil rights activist.  The global coronavirus pandemic has put a spotlight on Cesar Chavez's lifelong message: Our nation is nothing without our workers.

A very sad night in Phoenix. Commander Greg Carnicle was shot and killed tonight responding to a domestic violence call. He served in the Phoenix Police department for 31 years.  Our deepest sympathies to his family and the @PhoenixPolice family.
Please take a moment to pray hard for the 3 @PhoenixPolice Officers seriously injured in a shooting tonight in north Phoenix.

I’m incredibly sad to learn of the unexpected loss of Supervisor Richard Elias. He was a fighter for working families and protecting our state’s natural beauty. His loss leaves a huge void in Tucson and all of Arizona. My condolences to his family.  https://t.co/FJToywT0kO

Thank you @dougducey for getting this right.   It is time for @GeneralBrnovich to drop his lawsuit to deny more Arizonans health care.   Coronavirus will soon be a "pre-existing condition" for millions. Using our tax dollars to deny them health care is cruel and wrong. https://t.co/1qnhiEY5q0

My deepest condolences go out to the family and friends of Arizona's first victim.   In the coming weeks this will get harder—not easier.   Let's keep at it: stay home if you can wash hands stop the spread.  And many thanks to the health care workers on the front lines. https://t.co/1sAz9OdYg0

This is the right decision. Our @AZNationalGuard can be used for many lifesaving activities during the months to come. In addition to food security they can help with drive through testing logisitics and maintenance of critical infrastructure and operations. https://t.co/8DjAenoqjK

Our @AZNationalGuard has specialized training in disaster management and logistics. They need to be called up into service now to fight #COVID19 and support our critical infrastructure workforce prepare logistics for drive through testing and other lifesaving tasks. https://t.co/qjaNtACQlH

Congrats @JoeBiden on a tremendous presidential primary win in Arizona. Vice President Biden is the trusted and experienced leader to bring our country together during these unprecedented challenging times. https://t.co/hmrPGrksIC
This is the correct decision to protect public health and safety. It will help protect ourselves our loved ones and our entire community during this ongoing crisis. https://t.co/1fPNNlF63n

Congratulations to the newly elected Mayor of Tempe @coreywoodstempe. Corey will be a star in local government. A dynamic thoughtful and empathic leader. One of the very best people I’ve gotten to know in public service. Tempe’s future is bright. https://t.co/xjRaw5nJfh

Today’s my 50th. So of course @NicoleStantonAZ and @KateWGallego share a good laugh at my expense 😅. After 7 elections and 20 years in public life I’m more thankful than ever for the support from my family and the honor of serving our great community. https://t.co/HuiRWr8sZn

Our community mourns the loss today of firefighter Tommy Arriaga. He bravely served Tempe on the department’s Hazardous Materials Response Team until his diagnosis in 2019. My prayers are with the Arriagas and the Tempe Fire family. https://t.co/6XKyLND02u

This election is the most important in modern history and Joe Biden is the best choice to defeat Donald Trump and unite and heal our country. Read more about my choice to support Joe: https://t.co/3qVXLxzGwP

Who knows what @realDonaldTrump will say in Phoenix tonight. But I bet he won't mention his plan to:  - cut Medicare by $500 million - cut Medicaid by $900 million - cut Social Security by $24 billion - cut student aid by $170 billion  I'll hold the line against these #TrumpCuts.

On Saturday I saw “¡Americano! The Musical” @phxtheatre. It’s the  inspiring story of my friend and DREAMer Tony Valdovinos. Great music with an important message to Arizona: DREAMers are an essential part of our state deserve our full support and American citizenship. https://t.co/8aBZSfbGyI
Prayers up to Joyce Miller wife of my @HouseJudiciary Chairman @RepJerryNadler. She needs our love and support and she fights and recovers from pancreatic cancer. https://t.co/NAW0d4Yizh

.@DrBobParsons and @ReneeLParsons have done it again. Their generosity will ensure that 35 hard-working Dreamers have the opportunity to pursue their goals at @ASU. Our community is better because of Bob and Renee's commitment to helping others. https://t.co/47DePqkcuU
